website_summaries.verdict: The 50mm f/1.4 USM isn't Canon's top-of-the-line 50mm lens, but it is a solid performer.

customer_reviews.title: one of the best lens in the market - if you are lucky enough to get a good one
customer_reviews.text: I have owned three of these lens over the years, and two of them had some focusing issues. The one that focuses fine, is my favourite go to lens, from street photography to various wedding pictures, and general all round use. its a pretty magical lens for certain situations and at F1.2 it creates a one of a kind Bokeh which I love. its almost dream like in its beauty. I rate this lens up there with some of my Leica glass which costs substantially more. I have seen some negative reviews on this lens, but if you buy from Amazon and aren't happy its easy enough to get them replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Flappy Paddles

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value-for-money lens
customer_reviews.text: This was the first lens I bought to go with my Canon DSLRs when I first started to experiment with and learn about photography. Years later and I'm still using it for lots of my professional shoots. Yes, it's a bit plasticky and the autofocus is a bit noisy, but the picture quality is just superb and it is incredible value for money. I'd buy it again in a flash.
customer_reviews.author: Pieter

customer_reviews.title: Happy Intermediate Photographer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad's birthday, as he's recently taken up photography as a hobby. It is brilliant for indoor shots, due to its low aperture; which basically means how much light is let into the lens through to the camera. This means that for indoor use, you can get amazing bright shots of people, or objects! The only thing that is different for a amateur, is that you can't zoom in or out, but that isn't necessarily a bad thing, as you get another perspective of the image, as the photographer is forced to move! Brilliant lens would highly recommend for someone wanting to brighten up their indoor shots!
customer_reviews.author: Saif

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any Canon photographer
customer_reviews.text: I have surprised myself how much I have used this lens already. Both my cameras (Canon 400D and 7D) are APS-c sensors so require multiplying 1.6 x focal length. This lens equates to an 80mm lens which is ideal for portraits although I have used it for other topics. With an aperture at f1.8 lower than most zoom lenses this is great for capturing the subject when a small depth of field is needed. Although criticised for the plastic shell it is light and small to keep in anyone's camera bag. Also with being an EF lens it fits the older EOS film cameras and the Professional EOS 1's and 5's.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Single point focusing is not so good on auto focus
customer_reviews.text: This is quite a flimsy lens, but what can you expect for the price? Single point focusing is not so good on auto focus, as it just goes back and forth trying to find the right spot to focus on. So if you're confident with manual focus, it's not an issue. I've been through 2 of these lenses, because they break quite easily, so in the long run, better to invest in a higher quality lens.
customer_reviews.author: robynnlg

customer_reviews.title: High quality standard lens.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, lightweight compact lens. A bit faster than the f/1.8 version with better autofocus. Image quality is excellent. This lens can be used for just about everything. It’s great for landscapes as well as portraits and travel photography
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Bell

customer_reviews.title: not for novices
customer_reviews.text: Very good primary lens, but thats just what it is. It is ideal for very specific photography such as portraits, where the distance is fairly short and you are in complete control of the subject matter. When using it for landscape for example, you are often stuck with the situation that you cannot compose the view as you would like, because you cannot move far enough back to get everything in that you would like. We have become so used to having the zoom, that when we haven't got it, as with this lens, we are stuck.
customer_reviews.author: bill taylor

customer_reviews.title: Brill!
customer_reviews.text: Most others have gone into the technical specifics, so I'm just gonna sing its praise. This lens is super fast and super light. It never leaves my side; for something so small it makes sense to always have it on me. Carrying this and a zoom lens, I've been able to take everything I want on. The 50mm bodes well in fairly low light and social situations, being fast enough to catch anything you want. I actually dropped it this year, shattering the plastic part of the lens. Guess what? Still works. Gonna keep using it until it falls apart and when it does... I'll buy the same one again.
customer_reviews.author: Bishmanrock

customer_reviews.title: Possibly my favourite lens! It's worth calibrating it with your camera's ...
customer_reviews.text: Possibly my favourite lens! It's worth calibrating it with your camera's autofocus though as using it at f1.4 showed it to be focussing slightly short of the subject but once I dialled that in it's brought absolutely superb results. The only possibly downside I can think of would be if you wanted to use it for moving footage as the autofocus on it seems louder than some of the other lenses but for stills it's just great.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Stunning
customer_reviews.text: This little guy in combination with a Cannon 5D mk2 just shoots the most beautiful video. I used it for the first time on a project this week and I was very impressed with the results, beats my Cannon L series 24-105 hands down for those nice up close shots. I shot with the 24-105 one day and the 50mm the next, and under the conditions and the shots I was doing, indoors, close up the results from the 50mm were so much better. I shot a couple of stills of characters who will be appearing in a doc Im doing and again, beautiful results. If you have a cannon 5D and shoot video, then just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Decent lens for not a lot of money
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and cheerful (standard? ) lens for Canon. This lens equates to about 80mm when used with a crop frame sensor, as on the Canon 40D/50D. The faster f/1.8 aperture allows it to be a useful portrait lens. Okay it's got a plastic mount but is that really such a drawback? It will stand up to normal use fairly well I would think. Mine is a little bit noisy in focusing but otherwise does the job well. The optics are very good considering the price. Worth a punt I'd say.
customer_reviews.author: Dobro

customer_reviews.title: Great, no need to spend more (unless you're a pro!)
customer_reviews.text: Best starter lens and a must for any hobbyist. Incredibly versatile and at a fantastic price. If I could only have one lens I would pick this one, took it travelling with me in Thailand this summer and it held up fantastically performing well in varying scenarios and light conditions. And one of the best thing about this lens is the cost. Pair this with a entry to mid level dslr and you have a really capable camera set up that is cheap enough not to be constantly fretting over.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyG

customer_reviews.title: Cracking lens.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sharp. Though care needed to get to grips with the depth of filed, my previous lens did not go to 1.4. So this is new territory for me in having a prime. This is on a cropped sensor (7D) but with care and composition I have had some excellent results and when I compare this with a APS-C at 80mm, the 50mm is a lot sharper. Wish I had tried this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Best buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens, even on a crop body it works for portraits. I have taken so many photos of my baby boy growing into a toddler with some stunning results. My family now keep telling me to quit my job and become a photographer but its just because this lens is so damn good! I'm on my second now as Robert bless him knocked over the camera when on a tripod and smashed this to bits. The body was fine though phew. Its sometimes hard to frame the picture due to it being nearer 70mm on a crop body but stick with it. Just set the aperture to 1.8 and go have some fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this lens
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens, feel free to ask for some sample pictures if you're interested in buying as I've use it for a long time and have even bought one for a friend as a gift and he loves it also.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: good value 50mm lens
customer_reviews.text: It's just a good value 50mm lens - bought the upgraded version years later. It can be used in any 35mm digital cameras these days - you may need to manually focus the lens if it's used on another brand.
customer_reviews.author: S Chen

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I saw this on offer and couldn't resist. The build quality is poor as previously described but the image quality is fantastic. Canon don't supply lens hoods for basic lenses so that is something you need to purchase separately. I am very happy with the image quality for the price. On a bitter-sweet note, it is an excellent camera protector. I managed to drop my camera from about 5 feet straight onto the lens. The lens was toast as expected, but the camera survived without a scratch. I don't really mind losing a cheap lens if the expensive body survived!
customer_reviews.author: LeightonW

customer_reviews.title: Canon EF 50mm f/1.8 II lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens was recommended by my photo instructor as a good one to have if you do not want to carry loads of equipment around. It is a neat little lens and once you get into the swing of having to move yourself closer or further away from the subject then it is easy little lens to use. The thing to bear in mind is that there is no room for spontaneity. If you find you are the wrong distance from something that has suddenly happened in front of you, by the time you have moved it has gone. I would definitely recommend this lens if you want to go out with just your camera and nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hodgson

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding at this price
customer_reviews.text: For sheer value for money - the canon 50mm 1.8 II lens outshines most... yes build is plasticky, and light, but boy does it pack a punch. Images taken with this lens have silky smooth bokeh, and crystal sharp clarity. For anyone dipping their toes into photography, this should be the first lens you own. Yes of course theres a plethora of outstanding glass out there that will trump this little 50, but for the money it delivers and then some!
customer_reviews.author: Simon Johns

customer_reviews.title: My favourite lens
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me - a keen Canon photographer but without endless money to spend on kit - then this lens is a must. It's the first lens I'd recommend anyone buy after the kit lens. It punches far above its weight in terms of image quality. Most of my best pictures have been taken with this superb lens. It's ideal for portrait photography. The wide aperture makes it great to use in low-light situations. The auto focus is a little slow and noisy and can "hunt" a bit in low light. But you won't get anything better without spending three times the amount or more. An essential piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Waite

customer_reviews.title: Good little lens
customer_reviews.text: I'm still dipping my toes into the world of photography but a lens of this size was recommended so i went for this one. The lens is lightweight and i've been happy with the pictures it's taken but i'm not really examining them in great technical detail as more seasoned photographers might. I'm pleased i can take pics with good depth of field now. Only thing is that sometimes it seems unable to focus and whirs around but i see this as an op to practise manually focusing the lens. And my other expensive lens does the same thing so i'm not too bothered.
customer_reviews.author: Gumplock

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC LENS FOR LITTLE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this lens for ages now, and findings are as follows: - GOOD POINTS Amazing value Very fast 1.8 Maximum aperture Decent image quality for the money Excellent in low light, even without flash Very light in weight BAD POINT A tad plasticy build feel CONCLUSION For this price point, you really cannot go wrong. A MUST BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffers

customer_reviews.title: Great lense !
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this lense two days but already I am so pleased with it. The quality is a little lacking but the price makes it very affordable. The quality of the photos is excellent, very sharp and it's a very good starter lense for anyone. I don't think it will last a lifetime but for people like myself who are just starting out in photography the price is what makes it worth a try and the results, even for a novice like myself, are amazing. If you are wondering, as I did, if you really need another lense, don't, buy this lense and I hope you will enjoy using it as much as I have done already.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. A. Hemsworth

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: Definitely an upgrade for me but auto focus basically useless if wanting to use for video, the auto focus is insanely loud. Not a huge problem just need to use manual focus which can be a pain sometimes but the quality of the lens is worth it, nice blurry backgrounds and sharp image.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the best lens I own (and the cheapest).
customer_reviews.text: I bought this several years ago, shortly after I purchased my first DSLR (a 400D) and it's still with me, 2 camera replacements later (a 40D and now a 5D MKII). Yes, it feels extremely cheap and plasticy...yes, the auto-focus is really noisy but for the price, it's an amazing lens which should be in every Canon owner's camera bag. The f1.8 is fantastic and produces some great shots, the colours are rich and focus is sharp. The only bad thing I can say about this lens is that as it doesn't have any IS, you really need to have a steady hand, espsecially when shooting wide open. Other than that, I can't recommend this enough.
customer_reviews.author: George Stark

customer_reviews.title: Go for the f1.4 if you can
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lens, but the build quality really does match its price. I'm respectful of my equipment, but the focus ring still broke within a year. I've repaired and replaced it, but it took weeks to order the part from abroad. I can't stress enough that if you can stretch to cost of the 50mm f/1.4 then you really really should. I have no peace of mind with this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Nudi

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for the money - well worth owning
customer_reviews.text: Great lens and well worth the modest investment. It's small, lightweight and optically excellent. It's great to have the flexibility to stop up to 1.8 when light levels are low. Remember to stop down a little to get a sharper image if you don't need f1.8. It's not perfect, but it is good. Focus can be a little slow and the bokeh (the shape things go when out of focus) isn't the smoothest, but it depends what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Good little lens
customer_reviews.text: Good little lens, although I tend to use more as a backup lens for one of my bigger ones, which on one occasion was needed when the main one failed! Produces clear, crisp shots, and the f/1.8 certainly is very handy for lower light situations. My only complaint is the lack of stabilisation, which if you don't have the steadyist of hands will show on shots with a slow shutter speed, but generally fine at higher shutter speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Cripps

customer_reviews.title: Super lens
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens...a 50mm is a must in any camera bag. I'm not a great photographer, but this lens when used for relatively close up portrait shots delivers a great effect, depth and super photos. With regular offers available, this is considerably cheaper than one with a lower f value or other focussing features, but if you can live without those bits, its a great option!
customer_reviews.author: FBPGroup

customer_reviews.title: Cheap looking, but optical results very good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this from Amazon to supplement the kit lenses that came with my 550D. Due to APS-C sensor on the 550D, this lens is roughly equivalent to an 80mm fitted to 35mm camera, so not exactly the same as a 'nifty fifty' often fitted as standard to 35mm SLRs of years gone by, but not that far off. As many reviewers have said, build quality is quite 'plasticky' and it looks quite cheap (which it is!), but doesn't feel that flimsy to me. The promising news is that the image quality seems very good and is noticably superior to the kit lenses, especially when viewed at 100%. For the money, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hart

customer_reviews.title: it's out of auto-focus
customer_reviews.text: It’s fine. Good build and size. I don’t want a huge 50mm. Wide open it is a bit soft. And the one I got consistently frontfocused by an inch or so. But that can hopefully be adjusted in the camera (6D2). That said, the 50mm f/1.8 is brilliant for the price, so do you really beed the 1/2 a stop?
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Super lens at a bargain price
customer_reviews.text: This lens is excellent. Yes, the construction of the lens isn't great, but hey what do you expect at this price. The actual lenses used isn't a compromise though as they are excellent. The picture quality is sharp and you can get some stunning portraits. I got this fixed focal length (prime) lens for portraits and general street photography. I think this makes you a better photographer as you no longer have the liberty to stand in one place and adjust the focal lengths to frame your images. I felt this kept me better involved during the photography as I had to move myself for getting the right frame.
customer_reviews.author: Manish

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I buy this soooner?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as I had sold a couple of old lenses and had some spare cash to increase my lens collection. First impressions were mixed as the lens doesn't feel very substantial and has a cheap plastic feel to it, but after some use, would appear to be made of stronger stuff than expected. The images produced with this on my 60d are amazing - sharp and vibrant images and this lens has really made me enjoy getting out with my camera, it has reignited my interest. I've only given it four stars as the focus motor is quite loud and I feel that detracts from the magnificence of this lens.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Man

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Value.
customer_reviews.text: I'm delighted with this lens. It is light but robust, comparable in producing image quality with far more expensive lenses and functions equally well in both auto and manual modes. I have installed a 52mm UV filter and when in daylight try to remember to use a lens hood. It is wise, I think, to take this precaution to ensure getting the best from the lens.There are plenty of lengthy reviews which will give far more technical detail. I will not simply repeat all that here. I'm not surprised that the overwhelming response is so positive. This is a first rate lens at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Bluecashmere.

customer_reviews.title: brilliant lens for photo and video
customer_reviews.text: canons entry level 50mm 1.8 is the ideal "next lens" to buy for anyone wanting to move away from the standard lens supplied with their camera. It takes amazing portraits with a very pleasing "blur" in the background so your subject "pops". In my view the only thing which i find annoying is the manual focus ring, it's just too small (right at the very front of the lens) to do anything useful with (not a problem if you use autofocus) - of course if you have the money, you could go for the canon 50mm 1.4 which has a proper dedicated focus ring (.... and costs three times as much)
customer_reviews.author: Mr Penguin

customer_reviews.title: Good lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good lens for the price. Cheap. Lightweight. Takes a great picture. The sort of 50mm you'd expect with a shallow focus. Can't complain at all. For me it was a great backup lens travelling around the world. Didn't take up any weight or room in my bags and, when my main lens smashed, I was able to use this for a short while instead.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R. W. Lutter

customer_reviews.title: everyone should have one of these
customer_reviews.text: These are your best first lenses, I bought this as a first DSRL lense to go with my Canon 500D and it was amazing, set it to f/1.8 and point and click and you won't be upset. The bokeh is fantastic, it's well built, yes it's not USM or an L lense but you aren't going to notice and are going to be clicking happily with the speed of the lense. Well worth having, you zoom with your feet. One I regularly carry with me.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: Had this lens for a while now & it is definitely great value for money. In terms of image quality the photos are very sharp, especially in sunlight this lens takes beautiful shots. It isn't the best 50 mm lens available but for the price it is definitely worth it. A lot of people have complained about the noise the lens makes whilst focusing & I have to agree, it makes a lot of noise whilst focusing, however this isn't a huge negative in my opinion as it doesn't affect usage in anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Karim

customer_reviews.title: compact lens .. perfect
customer_reviews.text: Had some great results with this lens on my cannon 450 d camera , its an old camera but works really well for me , I'm no purist but its all about the eye and subject matter , had some great portrait pictures at a very sensible cost , easy to interchange as all canon lens are .
customer_reviews.author: graham horniblew

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money - ideal for amateur photographers!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality lens, and does the job perfectly. As can be expected with a cheap lens it does have a bit of a 'cheap feel', but the value for money is excellent especially for an amateur photographer! Well recommended as a first fixed lens for someone wanting to have an alternative option to a kit lens, and the small size makes it ideal to fit in a compact camera carrying bag
customer_reviews.author: Luke B

customer_reviews.title: Cheap build quality that produces expensive image quality
customer_reviews.text: Price = perfect, i paid £70 for mine. Size and weight are both great too. Focus speed and accuracy are good but the focus motor is noisy. f/1.8 is useable but not that sharp on my 5D, f/2.8 and above is very sharp however. bokeh (background blur) is good but 'harsher' than the 50mm f/1.4. The plastic lens mount doesn't bother me at all as the lens is so light that a metal mount would be overkill. manual focusing is fine, though the focus ring could be larger for this and i would prefer to have full time manual focus. All in all it's brilliant for the price with just a few caveats.
customer_reviews.author: H. Beevers

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied about this buy.I have a crop sensor body and I was looking of buying a 30mm lens so I will have a close to 50mm lens.But after I looked a lot of videos on youtube I see that the best portait lens is an 85mm.So my 50mm lens x 1.6 is close to 85.The lens is perfect and very sherp.I don't care about the plastic because I have the 18-55 lens from canon which was with my 350d from 2005 and is all plastic.I have been to wrc(acropolis rally) ,holidays on beach,snows on mountain and nothing happens all that year.
customer_reviews.author: DIMITRIOS CHEIMONAS

customer_reviews.title: Love this nifty fifty
customer_reviews.text: Despite having may other lenses I still love this lens. The quality of the image is fantastic for the price. Granted quality is all plastic fantastic, but look away from that, treat it with care and it will provide you will amazing pictures and as a bonus it makes the camera very light should you wish for an arm free of pain for the day. Not the quickest to focus, fair, not the quietest, agreed but its a great lens in low light and for portrait. Check the reviews. They really do speak for themselves!
customer_reviews.author: C. Horswill

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for photography, but for video, focusing may take some time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in April 2014, it's a great lens with fantastic sharpness for a great price. However if your like me who uses my Canon EOS 600D for video, be aware that the 1.6x cropped sensor turns it into a 80mm telephoto lens, and because of this, focusing becomes really sensitive and chances are you'll end up with some blurry shots. As a photography lens, it's awesome! I still highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Athif Shafiq

customer_reviews.title: A classic...
customer_reviews.text: I use this lens as a back up to my 50mm f1.4 and it does not disappoint. It came in the new Canon packaging including the new pinch lens cap which was a nice surprise. The quality of the lens itself is not that great as it is entirely made of plastic (including the mount) but for the price, the performance of the lens is very good it is very much the entry drug to anyone looking to buy their first prime lens or to the 50mm focal length (which I love dearly). Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: TheB

customer_reviews.title: The Plastic Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Although it does feel cheaper than other lens' I've bought, it's not a reason to be put off from buying it. The 1.8 stop produces some really smooth pictures. Blurred background, with detailed foreground. If you want a cheap lens for portrait/macro photography, this is definitely a lens that you should consider buying. This is by far the best lens in terms of what you get for your money.
customer_reviews.author: TheStudent (Alex)

customer_reviews.title: Not a camera connoisseur but we like this lens
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both researched portrait lenses before Christmas and brought each other this one (so had to return one!), but we agree that it was a good choice - we have taken some lovely portraits with this lens. We are still learning how to use it best, but the images we have been getting on our 550D have been sharp whether finely focused or widely focused. No complaints from this very amateur photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Drawtag1982

customer_reviews.title: Great nifty fifty - dont listen to the doubters
customer_reviews.text: People are always comaring this lens to the 1.4 and even the monsterous 1.2 but lets face it is if £75 approx not £250 or £500! It is a great lens, pin sharp and quick to focus. F1.8 is very "fast" and light and allows for lower ISO's. It is made out of plastic but stil feels robust and very usable. Everyone needs a nifty fifty and if you dont need the even shallower depth of field or crazy "bokeh" then this lens is sure to make you happy. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hammond

customer_reviews.title: going well after 5 years of use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a long time ago, and it is still going strong, Although it can be a little noisy on focusing it is still quick and gives a good sharp picture with great depth of field. A great alternative and money saver to the 1.4 or 1.2 model. I have been using this for 5 years and although i own "L" lenses this is still one of my go-to lenses and often sits on my second camera so i can use it quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Neil T

customer_reviews.title: Great little lens
customer_reviews.text: I'm not very good at photography but I wanted a better lens that the one that came with the Canon 500D, so based on the reviews I bought this one. It is very light and compact. I can't really say more about it as I need to learn to use it properly but I am pleased with some of the photos I have taken so far. As I said I am still getting to grips with photography in general but I am sure I won't be disappointed with this new lens.
customer_reviews.author: bluebellgirl

customer_reviews.title: Love this lens.
customer_reviews.text: I love this lens. I received it as a birthday gift. The clarity of the pictures is fantastic. I feel like I am taking photographs for the very first time as everything seems so sharp and new. Obviously it takes some getting used to that there is no zoom facility as that is what I have become used to doing, but this is just perfect for beautiful portrait and close up images.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. D. Madeley

customer_reviews.title: A great little lens
customer_reviews.text: What can be said that hasn't been said before about this little gem. It is a bit cheap and plasticy but it is really throw away price in the world of lenses. The quality of the images that can be produced are very good. It punches well above it's price and if you look after your kit I'm sure it will last for some time. If you hit it off things I wouldn't give it more than a week. On a crop camera it becomes a really cheap portrait lens.
customer_reviews.author: Regaman

customer_reviews.title: Nothing better at this price tag
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The best camera lens you will buy ever, EVER...at this price tag. Do no underestimate f/1.8. Muahahaha Cons: .... at this price I wouldn't dare say something like, 'its made of plastic', of course it is. But still, not necessarily a bad thing... or is it? I don't care, I love this lens. Verdict: Of course, buy it.
customer_reviews.author: R.tag

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for portraits
customer_reviews.text: Amazing value, this lens is an excellent addition to the kit lens, the aperture gives such beautiful images with very sharp focus in a narrow field of view, drawing all the attention to your subject and away from distractions in the background. If you have the smallest sensor Canon you end up having to move a little further back which can be challenging indoors but the quality of the pictures more than makes up for it!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Canon's Bargain Offering.
customer_reviews.text: This fragile looking lens defies it's appearance by being on of the sharpest knives in the box. With a fast aperture and fast focusing it gives one an opportunity to employ the discipline of Henri Cartier Bresson and use a standard lens in your photography. No zoom, no I.S./V.R. just you and the lens that nearest represents what the human eye sees. I looked on E bay for a bargain, but because this lens is held in such high esteem prices for secondhand examples exceded the price Amazon asked for a brand new lens. Guess what I did? That's right I bought one from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mulcherrman

customer_reviews.title: the image quality is good, probably as I use apertures around f8
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this standard lens for my Full-frame Canon 6D camera, but found its performance disappointing, with a very low contrast, almost milky haze over low dark areas of a scene. In full sunlight however, the image quality is good, probably as I use apertures around f8. The construction is plastic as it is a budget lens and is of course, very affordable. I don't use it often...
customer_reviews.author: B. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Pleasing Lens.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleasing lens, makes for some very nice pictures indeed. Crisp and clear. However, it often takes a while to focus, usually in low light. Occasionally it simply won't focus on what you want it to, which is a good reason to get good and manual focusing! Overall, I am pleased with this and, if I were you dear reader, I'd just go and buy it now. It's absolutely great for the money, a Nifty Thrifty Fifty.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product - not expensive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens first to use with an adaptor ring for my Lumix G10 (which comes with a very bad lens kit) and the canon 50mm was great. It is very sharp and makes any picture looks good and professional. Using it with an adaptor, you can't change the aperture nor use the auto focus, but it doesn't matter, once with the 1.8 aperture, you can make great portraits and pictures in low light. Then I bought a Canon 550D and am glad to use this lens with it as well. If you don't have much money to buy an USM or other fancy lens, you should get this one.
customer_reviews.author: fillipe

customer_reviews.title: my favourite slr lens, buy a long shot.
customer_reviews.text: without a doubt, the single best lens one can own if you have a canon DSLR. I need say no more, buy it now!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian B.

customer_reviews.title: Canon Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: As has been said in the majority of reviews, this is a fine lens for the money. However my first lens, delivered quickly by Amazon, on close inspection revealed a crazed defect on one of the inner elements. It was easily spotted by the naked eye from either the front of the lens or the back. Consequently, I would question Canon's quality control procedure on this lens. What I cannot fault is Amazon's return procedure. DHL were on the doorstep to collect the lens, post paid some four hours after contacting them. More remarkable was that four hours later my replacement lens arrived from Amazon. Exemplary!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nifty Fifty!
customer_reviews.text: This 'Nifty Fifty' is an excellent prime lens, whilst the quality of build has been questioned in previous reviews, this is such a lightweight lens that the plastic lens mount wont be under pressure so not really an issue in that respect. The focus speed can be rather sluggish and noisy (in an audible sense) but dont let that put you off as the image quality is very sharp and I noticed a clear difference to the standard 18-55mm kit lens which sits dormant in my camera bag. Go ahead, purchase this lens you wont be disapointed!
customer_reviews.author: MR O

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Lovely lends for the price; nice and sharp, good colours and contrast and for the price it's great. The only thing I have to get used to is the motor driven focus. While I wouldn't call the focus slow, there is a definite difference between this and the USM/STM lenses when trying to go for that quick shot. On the whole though, if you want a cheap f1.8 lens to play with then go for it.
customer_reviews.author: I. Cummings

customer_reviews.title: A steal at the price
customer_reviews.text: I've used this lens for about a week and it scores well on 2 counts: 1.The images are crystal clear. I use Mac Aperture 3 software and shoot in RAW, and it's amazing what you can do with the images. (By the way, Aperture 3 is now available as an App from Apple at the giveaway price of £44). 2. It forces you compose your image, which I like. It means you're being a proper photographer. This is the first Canon lens I've used where I feel I'm getting true value for money.
customer_reviews.author: davidmacgowan

customer_reviews.title: A really beautiful lens which allows for lovely depth of field but ...
customer_reviews.text: A really beautiful lens which allows for lovely depth of field but I had to take time to adjust to not being able to zoom in and more importantly, zoom out. I feel a 35mm would have been a better choice for me. Also on the extremely unfortunate instance I broke this lens, as it fell from roughly 1m high and the central lens popped out, it was relatively easy to, 3 hours later, pop it back in and it actually still works perfectly for me! So perhaps a little flimsy in build but gives lovely images!
customer_reviews.author: Nylah

customer_reviews.title: But its such a great lens, really sharp and great for street photography
customer_reviews.text: Ok I know its Plastic.Ok I know its probably the cheapest ef lens that canon produce. But its such a great lens, really sharp and great for street photography. Yes I know there is the 1.4 and the 1.2l. And I'm sure they are amazing, but they have amazing prices too. Love this lens everyone should own one. Buy this and spend the 920 quid you saved on not buying the 1.2 L on a different lens
customer_reviews.author: Mr Dominic M Goy

customer_reviews.title: Can not be beaten for price vs performance
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the cheapest lenses you can buy for canon and pretty much everyone can not fault the performance of the lens. The lens is sharp from corner to corner and at f 1.8 it is nice and fast. The build quality is a bit plasticy though and it is quite noisy when foussing. If you are new to SLRs and looking for something else to add to the kit lens this is an excellent lens to buy so you can experiment with some low light photography or depth of field.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Sharpest lens I've got
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little bit uncertain of the build quality of this lens - it's very light and feels flimsy - but I've had it for some time now and it's easily the sharpest lens I have. Contrast and geometry are also excellent. I know that "prime" (that is, non-zoom) lenses are almost always higher quality than zooms, but I didn't expect to see such a leap in quality over the one of my zoom lenses that cost over £300! When used on Canon APS-C digital cameras (mine is the EOS 40D) the Canon 50mm 1.8 is a great lens for portraits.
customer_reviews.author: John in Low Fell

customer_reviews.title: WOOOWW!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I haven never written a review, but I had to as I love this lens so much. It is perfect for portraits, beauty shots and close-ups. I am so impressed at how clear & crisp the images are! Definitely a must have, especially for this price. It is so worth it!! Best amazon purchase so far!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!
customer_reviews.text: I know this is a standard piece of kit for many slr users, and I can see why! For this price, it is truly amazing. I have used this lens for over a year now. It is a great little lens. When wide open, f1.8, it can be a little soft, but this is hardly noticable on standard sized photos. It is built to a budget, but it IS a budget lens. Don't let the low price put you off though. The overall quality is still excellent. Great lens, recommended
customer_reviews.author: GM29

customer_reviews.title: Great prime lens, poor focusing in very low light.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first prime lens and after using this lens at a party it's a great lens, Especially for the money. Yes it's cheaply made but it does produce some good shots. The only problem I found was focusing in the dark it would seek quite a lot, sometimes missing a good shot. The 1.8 aperture is very low and good in low light and creates great images with bokeh backgrounds that helps focus on the main subject. I would recommend this lens to anybody with a canon dslr with a low budget .
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: A great lens
customer_reviews.text: A nice little lens. I have this on my camera most of the time. The image is sharp, and the low light capabilities are really good. The only time it is a problem for me is close range groups of people. But I should get a wide angle for that purpose. Its a bit plasticky feeling. But it still feels quality, and for the price it is amazing value.
customer_reviews.author: Adrain Vickers

customer_reviews.title: plastic diamond
customer_reviews.text: Whatever lenses you have in your arsenal, this one must be apart of it. The cost is in direct proportion to the construction, but the quality of the optics makes this a wander buy. With a constant f/1.8 this makes a lovely portrait lense; crisp, clear pictures that really do take your dslr up another level. One word of caution though, you will need to buy a lense hood seperately (naughty Canon), and it's awful to use; why make something so simple so bloody awkward. Anyway, super lense and super cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: This lens is gold
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from the 'nifty fifty' ef50mmf1.8 which was too plastic and light, not sturdy, but with excellent image quality and a very faithful business partner for many years, to this and it's ages ahead. Everything about it is top, like the entire ef ultrasonic series, recommended asap as a general prime lens, excellent optics, very fast and bright, very sharp. Works wonders for video too if you focus manually.
customer_reviews.author: Demetris Christodoulides

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant lens, great value
customer_reviews.text: A professional photographer recommended this lens to me as a 'must have' if I want to take my photography to the next level. I've found it to be an amazing lens for portraiture and I've seen immediate improvements in my work since using it. As an amateur I find it tricky to get the focus just right (even when using auto focus), and I'm not used to working with a fixed length lens either. But overall, I'm delighted - a great lens at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens must to have
customer_reviews.text: I love the canon Lens however when I got it this item.. the lens wrapped with simple plastic, no fancy packing, .. does not feel like Canon. This is made is Malaysia not Japan
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent results
customer_reviews.text: I got this lens as a Christmas present to use with my EOS 450D and it's been attached to my camera since. I took lots of portraits of my family using natural and artificial light and the results have been excellent every time. I love the DoF you can achieve with this lens - it really makes your subject stand out! I am very impressed with the EF 50mm and would definitely recommend it to anyone, especially considering it's the cheapest Canon SLR lens I have found online. I only wish I'd found it 6 months ago!
customer_reviews.author: Maria Anderson

customer_reviews.title: just buy one...not much more to say
customer_reviews.text: There are plenty of reviews about this lens, and I echo the majority... For the price, you'll be surprised how good the results are when using this lens...be that in low light conditions without a flash, or portraits, or just general shots that you want a good depth too...this lens does it all. And okay, the build quality isn't great, but what do you expect for £80...all I can tell you is that the results are well worth every penny. A must have for every budding photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Lens
customer_reviews.text: This one of the best lenses I have for my Canon 60d. I love the shallow depth look once you have taken some pictures. Also filming on your DSLR with this product is fantastic, especially for those close up shots. There will be some who think this product is a bit on the pricy side, but I promise you based on the quality of this, you will not regret it. Definitely a Lens for all occasions.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Soprano

customer_reviews.title: It does work but...
customer_reviews.text: This lens does work ok but it wasn't as new as described, it wasn't it the best condition. It has 2 small hairs with a little dust inside and is very mechanical when focusing...juddering. I have accepted it due to the low price but I am not expecting it to last as long as if I bought a new one due to its condition. If the hairs were in a position to affect the images taken then I would be sure to refuse it and would've returned it.
customer_reviews.author: PL

customer_reviews.title: Great lens
customer_reviews.text: Great lens, light and of great quality. It absorbs light in an incredible way, allowing you to shoot without flash in most circumstances. The focus is very sharp, delivering absolutely quality images. It does give a bit of vignetting compared to the 1.2 lens, but this lens is better value for money I'd say. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: It really is the worst built lens ever but on the plus side the glass is very good. I love the depth of field control that this lens has and the fact that it is possible to take low light fast action pictures. The autofocus is so noisy that when I switched back to an STM lens I thought the camera had stopped working. For 64 quid it's a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Essential Budget Lens!
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic lens for a great price! I wish all good lenses cost this much! If your after a cheap lens for Portrait work and close-ups then this small lens is essential. I wasn't sure at first but after testing it out in my local camera shop I had to get it. A lot of reviews mention how cheap it looks and feels, but this hasn't been an issue at all. Is easy to put on the camera and take off (and I'm heavy handed!). Another review said it makes taking pictures more interesting and creative because of not being able to zoom. I couldn't agree more, especially when taking pics of my baby and pet dog!
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: I love this lens...
customer_reviews.text: Because it makes me look good. The photo's produced through my canon 40D using this put the kit lens to shame. Awesome colours, pin-sharp focus and all for 50 squids. I've had it about 4 years now (I'm revisiting some purchases and writing reviews where they weren't done first time around.) and it's as good as the day I bought it. Can't recommend it enough, if you're on a budget or not.
customer_reviews.author: Emmster

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price/performance
customer_reviews.text: Excellent lens. Really good for portrait photography. One friend borrows this lens from me often, as it gives far better results that the lens that came with her camera. In terms of price/performance this is one of the favourite lenses in my collection.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Lauder

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, cheap. 100% Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely the best budget lens. I absolutely love it, you won’t be disappointed! It’s been ages since I bought it still works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For what is it and what it costs: brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Of course more expensive lenses will render better results... but that being said I have a more expensive lens (20mm f2.8) and yet I use this one more, and like the images it gives me. I use it on a Canon 550D, so I'm apparently getting the equivalent of a 80/85mm lens, or something, with the crop factor. I sometimes need to shoot in lower light and that's the only reason I want to upgrade to the 50mm f1.4.
customer_reviews.author: Miles

customer_reviews.title: The best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: This is great little lens, a must for anyone who has just got a canon DSLR. Cheap and cheerful, this little lens is great just to have purely for its adaptability. Great optics for its price point. People say its build quality is not up to scratch but they are forgetting its the cheapest lens you can get! Others say it doesn't last more than a year to 14 months. I say if you are still using and loving it after that amount of time its time to upgrade to the f./ 1.4 USM. Buy this lens!
customer_reviews.author: BiggusNickus

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: Little to say about this article really... this is such a must have! For the price, I would recommend any photographer to have it in its camera bag. Perfect for portraits with a large enough aperture, the lens will also provide landscape pictures with very good sharpness and contrast levels. Autofocus is not very quick and can be heard, but this doesn't make any difference at all in my view.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT NIFTY FIFTY
customer_reviews.text: This lens lives up to its reputation amongst photographers. It seems to work very well. I am still learning what it can do. I am not an expert amateur and may take a while before I realise it's full potential. First results are very promising. It is on a 40D at present and obviously behaving like an 80mm. I shall try it later on a 5D MK II to see the difference between 50mm and 80mm.
customer_reviews.author: HS

customer_reviews.title: feels very light and plastic but works well for anyone wanting a standard lens with nice bokeh and shallow depth of field at wide aperture
customer_reviews.text: cheap lens , feels very light and plastic but works well for anyone wanting a standard lens with nice bokeh and shallow depth of field at wide aperture
customer_reviews.author: Anthony H Capper

customer_reviews.title: Great starter lens
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant lens for the beginner photographer. Really sharp images and a nice bokeh effect (background blur) at f1.8. Loses a mark for being slightly slow at focusing and being a little cheap in the old build quality department, but that's definitely no reason to over look this lens. It's an absolute must for the starter photographer, but if you're looking for something a little bit more robust and "pro" go for the 50mm f1.4 or f1.2 versions.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Favourite Prime
customer_reviews.text: This is my favourite all-rounder lens. It looks great on the camera, handles well, focuses quickly, has fab low light capability (DOF is very shallow wide open with quite a steep fall off), sweet bokeh, and its sharp. If I had only one lens for my Canon...this would be it (or in a lower price range the 85mm f1.8, which I also loved...or buy both!).
customer_reviews.author: BambooThang

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, Fast, Cheap
customer_reviews.text: For the price, can't beat this lens. Really sharp, fast lens. Autofocus isn't the fastest but does the job, and you couldn't expect anything too great for the price. Using this on a crop sensors makes it very nice for portraits with an effective focal length about 80mm. Build quality is only ok. Quite plasticy but again for the price it's great. All in all great lens and great price.
customer_reviews.author: Colm K.

customer_reviews.title: Great lens, good value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens mainly to combat my own laziness. I had got into the habit of only using a canon 18-200 efs. The zoom is a nice piece of kit in its own right, but this 50 makes me think more about the composition of my photos. It's also small and light enough that it's no trouble to take it everywhere. At 1.4, DOF is very shallow close up, which can give some fun effects. Even when it's not wide open, this lens is great for informal indoor portraits without flash. I've had it a couple of months and I'm still having fun.
customer_reviews.author: Ggbn

customer_reviews.title: I would have loved the f1
customer_reviews.text: I would have loved the f1.2 L, but I simply couldn't justify it as a lot of my friends have the f1.8 and find that great, so the f1.4 was a bit of a compromise between the two, either way I love it, being a prime I tend to chop and change between this and the 100mm f2.8 Macro for highly detailed ultra sharp portraits, great lens, I am happy with it :-)
customer_reviews.author: Mike T

customer_reviews.title: Essential
customer_reviews.text: An essential lens for any serious photographer, this 'Nifty Fifty' offers great image quality at a great price. This lens does not zoom at all...to get nearer your subject you have to physically move towards it encouraging you to 'think and compose' in a different way. Great for landscapes and portraits this really should be in every 'togs bag.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Nifty Fifty / Fantastic Plastic
customer_reviews.text: Nifty Fifty / Fantastic Plastic... call it what you will. A must have because it's fairly fast and sharp. F1.4 and F1.2 versions are better quality but 3 to 6 times the price. Focusing is pretty noisy, so if it's a concern or you want to do video work think about the STM pancake lenses
customer_reviews.author: Dasam

customer_reviews.title: The Plastics are Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: The Kit Lens is now boxed, the 50mm Prime is now my primary lens. Yes I'm running back and forth to get the image and the proportion I want; though the 18-55mm kit lens allows me to zoom; the clarity and crispness of the 50mm make the images astoundingly Superior compared to the kit lens. The lens is actually heavier than my EOS 1000D, and the build quality feels solid and resilient. Three selling points: 1. Great DOF (Depth of Field) 2. Excellent low light ablities. 3. real Sharp images especially at f2.8 and above.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Smert

customer_reviews.title: You NEED this in your collection.
customer_reviews.text: Oh my word! So sharp! I've been using it with my new 7D Mk 2, and it's beautiful! Wide open there's some gorgeous bokeh, and I've enjoyed filming outside - between the UK's sodium orange street lights! My cats portraits are wonderful now - super blurry background, and crisp kitty at the front, and all under natural light.
customer_reviews.author: SarahC

customer_reviews.title: Favourite 50mm lens
customer_reviews.text: My favourite 50mm lens out there, the creamy bokeh machine, perfect for events and portraits and low light conditions. Image quality is simply amazing. Stunning piece of glass, makes everything look great. Combine it with a full frame camera and you don't need anything else to be happy with your photos for a long, long time.
customer_reviews.author: chris panas

product_meta.title: Canon EF 50 mm-f/1.4 USM Lens 20 cm - Black
product_meta.description:
Style Name:EF 50 mm-f/1.4 USMStandard lens featuring quality and portability. Two high-refraction lens elements and gaussian optics eliminate astigmatism and suppress astigmatic difference. Crisp images with little flare are obtained even at the maximum aperture.

BOX CONTAINS


Canon EF 50mm - f/1.4 USM Lens
E-58U 58mm Snap-On Lens Cap
Lens Dust Cap E (Rear)
1-Year Warranty
feature_bullets: Focal length and maximum aperture: 50 mm 1:1.4
Lens construction: Seven elements in six groups
Focus adjustment: Overall linear extension system with USM

specifications.Included Components: Canon EF 50mm - f/1.4 USM Lens, E-58U 58mm Snap-On Lens Cap, Lens Dust Cap E
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars9,365 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
